result.execSummary:
The defendant James V Bunda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber.  Straight time if imposed.
08/16/16 COURT GRANTS SENTENCE CREDIT OF 146 DAYS IF IMPOSED.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Second Amended Information

Defendant James V Bunda in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Defendant completed DTC and graduated DTC on 7/20/16.  State moves to amend Count #1 to misdemeanor theft charge under 943.20(1) - class A misdemeanor.  State to file a 2nd amended information by the end of the day today, 8/2/16.  State makes statements.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements and requests to have until Friday, 8/5/16 to submit calculation on pretrial incarceration credit.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER  (CREDIT - _ days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   **transfer allowed to Milwaukee County** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  WAIVED
